task.summary: character_classes.py renamed weaponry.attackDie to attack_die renamed CharacterSheet.__repr__ to full_str implemented characterSheet.melee_attack(self) - runs over equipped weapons, returns a dict with: - num: the number of attacks the character makes - effects: the effects to be applied to the attacked target - calculation: a damage function for the weapon: - this is to include character/class/race relevant bonus - weapons: the weaponry involved: - conveys the damage effects, and weapon attack function soon to make a similar variant for creature, given its somewhat more limited complexity wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block creatures.py: nothing important, just killed some whitespace encounter.py: further work towards implementing do_battle() enums.py: changed DAMAGETYPE subclasses to take arguments - can now instantiate self with given damage value a couple debug outs I haven't murdered yet. functions.py: dtypes no longer passed to GenericMelee.__init__() dtypes no longer a self value of GenericMelee.__init__() - contained within the weapon itself, or applied by its attack function, not needed here. misc.py: implemented a wrapper to call random as Die.random(self, upper) wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block weaponry.py: as mentioned in character_classes, renamed .attackDie to .attack_die renamed equipFuntion to equip_function

Simple Melee combat at last!
its come a long way, and it finally meets milestone 1, I can init a player, and some creatures, and they can try to kill eachother.
renamed the file character_classes to character_sheet
character_sheet: - moved init_wulfgar function to the end, so its out of the way - pushed the Equipment class out to its own file - pushed the events class out to its own file - added .is_lucky() - added .get_next_level_xp() - finished reworking get_attack - pushed __LINE__ debug function to its own file
classes: - removed the hitpoints_lvl1, its set under character_sheet with hit_die
creatures: - retagged the alias for dnd5e_weaponry to weaponry as I do elsewhere - gave creatures the equipment class, so they use same methods as player - changes default (dis)advantage vars to set() from None - added .atk_bonus and .effects vars - removed .check_attack() - removed .get_attack() - added .receive_damage() - added .melee_attack() - added ._wpn() - added .get_armor_class() - added Crab creature - added a few more fields to weapon: - atk_type: enums.ATTACK, set - wield_from: enums.EQUIP_SLOT, single - added more debug prints buried behind an if name == main block
encounter: - Party.__init__ now converts its args to list, from tuple - Party.size() added - Party.__str__() added - Encounter: - .init now copies Party Members rather than directly using - .do_battle() now has some text feedback - will remove in time - huge rewrite, pretty mch entirely new function - .generate_hostile() no involves party size mods, and difficulties - also not returns a reward dict - currently exp only - the simplistic battle routine buried in an if name == main block
enums: - changed enums import from * to as misc, related changes throughout - killed a couple debug prints - added GENERIC to WEAPONS type - added EQUIP_SLOT enum
events: - entirely new, though no new code, exiled from inside character_sheet
inventory: - entirely new, exiled from inside character_sheet - more internal variables, for more places to put gear - equip_weapon() now checks for jaw, hands, and fingers slots.
misc: - Die.__init__() no longer forces a min value of 2 sides - 1d1 possible - .random() altered to shortcut if 1 sided.
weaponry: - importing ATTACK and EQUIP_SLOT enums - .__init__() args changed, added atk_type - sets self.atk_type and self.wield_from now as well - greataxe test def altered to set atk_type and wield_from
trace: - entirely new, added to carry any debug related functions worth having - implemented __LINE__(), which behaves as __FILE__+_+__LINE__ does in C

Rudimentary leveling now works
fixed an issue with creature weapons lacking weapon.flags not having their attack_die set.
fixed encounter continuing and calling choice on a party which has already been eliminated.
Character_sheet: - experience now hides behind a getter/setter. Setter calls levelup - levelup handled via re-calling __init__, inserting current stats - .__init__() modified to check if relevant attributes are None or set, if none they are defaulted, if set they are used as is - ._wpn() now used hand.roll instead of hand.attack_die.roll()
Classes: - Barbarian: - class_ability is no longer defaulted unless not assigned - .__init__() now takes many configuration arguments, to pass in state - tests those for None, if None, defaults, else keeps what was passed
Creatures: - like with character_sheet, ._wpn() now uses hand.roll()
encounter: - Party.__str__() now includes character level in its return - Encounter.do_battle() now tests for active party internally too - immediately after selecting a weapon, but before choosing a target fixes trying to choose target from a party with no members - removed the per-hit input(), now runs the entire encounter at once. - now returns a dict for failure as well rather than just zero - Encounter.generate_hostile(): - currently returns exp equal to stated for creatures - this is for testing purposes to accelerate growth. - it will not stay this fast - if name == main: - now tests sum of hp for player one and two before terminating. - divides the rewards among the players - sets their hp to max after each iteration
inventory: - had a case where creatures were not setting flags on their weapons - this caused Weapon.equip_weapon() to not assign its attack die fixed
weaponry: - Weapon.roll() was still using the old .attackDie name, retagged it

quick housecleaning update
character_sheet: - CharacterSheet now inherits from common Entity class - re-organised and stripped some variables that Entity now owns - .set_saving_throws() now belongs to Entity - .is_lucky() now belongs to Entity - .melee_attack() now belongs to Entity - ._wpn() now belongs to Entity - receive_damage() now belongs to entity - .get_attack() is eliminated - debug block now import print from trace - minor edits to the print statements to reflect change
classes: - appended background.skills to self.skills
creatures: - Creature now inherits from common Entity class - re-organised and stripped some variables that Entity now owns - .set_saving_throws() now belongs to Entity - .is_lucky() now belongs to Entity - .melee_attack() now belongs to Entity - ._wpn() now belongs to Entity - receive_damage() now belongs to entity - minor edits to the print statements int he debug block
encounter: - debug block now import print from trace - minor edits to the print statements to reflect change
entity: - Entity created from common features of Creature and CharacterSheet
enums: - BACKGROUND.SKILL renamed to .SKILLS, its a set of multiple, pluralise
trace: - new function print() - overrides default print function. - inserts __LINE__() before given args

quick bugfix and update to encounter test code Forgot to check target armor class, so no one was ever missing, lol.
character_sheet: - silenced the 'level up' print in CharacterSheet.level_up() - added level to .dict_short()
encounter: - Encounter.init() - added verbose, silent, auto_run and debug_rewards parameters - Encounter.do_battle() - wrapped the prints behind tests for verbose and silent - wrapped the input that halts iteration behind a test for auto_run - killed some old commented code - attacks now get target ac, attack rolls less than target ac miss - XP_thresholds now has 7 difficulty levels - each is 2/3 of the next - test code now runs until level 20 is reached

its come a long way, and it finally meets milestone 1, I can init a player, and some creatures, and they can try to kill eachother.
